benchmark_details.name: Sycophancy under Pressure: Evaluating and Mitigating Sycophantic Bias via Adversarial Dialogues in Scientific QA
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a unified evaluation framework to quantify the impact of sycophantic context on model behavior in scientific question answering, measuring how much user-imposed social pressure distorts model outputs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically investigate sycophantic behavior in large language models within the context of scientific question answering and to propose an evaluation framework and method for mitigation.

data.source: The training data was constructed from the ARC-Challenge training set, augmented with synthetic dialogues demonstrating user-induced pressure.
data.annotation: Synthetic adversarial dialogues prompted for factual reasoning

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model's accuracy under direct misleading conditions and the proportion of correct rejections of misleading cues.
methodology.interpretation: A higher Sycophancy Resistance Rate indicates a stronger ability to resist user-imposed distortion.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted on ARC-Challenge and GPQA-Diamond datasets.
